restaurant.name: Bear Lodge Inn
restaurant.tagline: Cozy Cabin Diner in the Woods
restaurant.description: Every meal is cozy, comforting, and designed to be gentle on the stomach while still tasting like real food made with love.

dietaryNotes.mealPattern: 6 small meals per day - liquids and soft foods prioritized
rules: Small portions every 2-3 hours (1-1.5 cups max)
Liquids digest better than solids - soups and brothy meals are ideal
No spicy foods - risk of variceal bleeding
Air fryer instead of deep fryer
Chew food until mashed-potato consistency before swallowing
If on levodopa, eat protein at different times than medication

items.name: Custard French Toast
items.description: Soft, warm, and sweet. Easy on the stomach and full of comfort.

instructions: Beat eggs with milk and vanilla until smooth.
Soak bread slices until saturated but not falling apart.
Melt butter in pan over medium-low heat.
Cook each side until golden and custardy inside.

items.name: Sausage Egg Breakfast Bowl
items.description: All the flavor of a breakfast sandwich in a fork-friendly bowl.

instructions: Scramble eggs until soft and fluffy.
Cook sausage until no pink remains, crumble finely, drain fat well.
Combine all in a bowl, top with cheese.

items.name: Scrambled Eggs & Toast
items.description: Classic diner comfort with yogurt on the side.

instructions: Melt butter in non-stick pan over low heat.
Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Cook slowly, stirring gently until soft curds form.
Serve with buttered toast and yogurt.

items.name: Fluffy Pancakes
items.description: Soft, fluffy, and swimming in syrup. Classic Larry breakfast.

instructions: Whisk egg, milk, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed (lumps OK).
Cook on buttered griddle over medium-low heat.
Flip when bubbles form on surface.
Serve soft with butter and maple syrup.

items.name: Cream of Wheat
items.description: Warm, gentle, and comforting. Perfect start to any day.

instructions: Heat milk in saucepan until simmering.
Slowly whisk in cream of wheat.
Remove from heat, stir in butter and brown sugar.

items.name: Cottage Cheese & Peaches
items.description: Light, protein-rich, and naturally sweet.

items.name: Yogurt, Banana & Honey Bowl
items.description: Creamy, sweet, and full of easy calories.

items.name: Banana Protein Smoothie
items.description: Liquid calories that go down easy. Great when solids are tough.

categories.name: Soups & Brothy Bowls
categories.description: Liquids empty the stomach when solids can't. Soup is Larry's best friend.

items.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
items.description: Warm broth, soft noodles, shredded chicken. The ultimate comfort.

instructions: Add carrots, cook until very soft (15 min).
Add noodles, cook until very soft.

items.name: Egg Drop Soup
items.description: Silky egg ribbons in warm broth. Ideal for tough stomach days.

ingredients: 1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp cold water
instructions: Stir in cornstarch slurry to thicken slightly.
Slowly drizzle beaten eggs into simmering broth while stirring gently.
Season with salt and serve immediately.

items.name: Tomato Soup & Grilled Cheese
items.description: Creamy soup with melty white-bread grilled cheese.

instructions: Heat soup with milk until warm (not boiling).
Grill on medium-low until golden and cheese melts.
Cut sandwich into strips for dipping.

items.name: Turkey & Rice Soup
items.description: Gentle, filling, and perfect midday comfort.

instructions: Simmer broth with carrots until very soft.

items.name: Creamy Potato Soup
items.description: Silky, warm, and filling. Blended smooth.

instructions: Boil potatoes in broth until very soft.

items.name: Chicken & Rice Broth Bowl
items.description: Simple, soothing, perfect when appetite is low.

items.name: Chicken Pot Pie Bowl
items.description: All the comfort of pot pie, no crust needed.

instructions: Mix soup with milk, heat gently.
Add chicken and very soft vegetables.

items.name: Lo Mein Noodle Soup
items.description: Extra-brothy lo mein for when solid food is too much. Chinese comfort in a bowl.

instructions: Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and ginger.
Add cooked noodles and shredded chicken.
Warm through and serve in a big bowl.

categories.name: Bear Lodge Dinner Specials
categories.description: The one 'real meal' of the day - satisfying but still gentle.

items.name: Balsamic Shredded Pork
items.description: Larry's favorite - tender pork with sweet balsamic over creamy mashed potatoes.

instructions: Place pork in slow cooker with broth.
Cook on low 6-8 hours until shreddable.

items.name: Butter Garlic Pork Loin
items.description: Slow-cooked pork in a buttery garlic broth. Rich flavor, tender texture.

instructions: Place pork loin in slow cooker.
Add broth, butter, garlic powder, and salt.
Cook on low 6-8 hours until fork-tender.

items.name: Creamy Beef Stroganoff
items.description: Rich and cozy over soft egg noodles. A classic.

instructions: Stir in soup and sour cream.
Serve over very soft egg noodles.

items.name: BBQ Shredded Chicken Bowl
items.description: All the BBQ flavor without the heaviness.

instructions: Mix shredded chicken with BBQ sauce.

items.name: Smoky Paprika Chicken & Rice
items.description: Mild smoky seasoning on tender chicken. Bold flavor, gentle on the stomach.

instructions: Mix paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Melt butter in pan over medium heat.
Cook chicken until done, 6-7 minutes per side.
Serve over white rice with pan juices.

items.name: Teriyaki Pork & Rice
items.description: Sweet teriyaki-glazed shredded pork over fluffy rice.

instructions: Warm shredded pork with teriyaki sauce in a pan.

items.name: Turkey Gravy Toast Bowl
items.description: Open-face comfort food you eat with a fork. Like a smothered sandwich.

instructions: Serve with mashed potatoes on side.

items.name: Turkey Meatloaf
items.description: Soft, savory, and served with creamy mashed potatoes.

instructions: Mix turkey, egg, breadcrumbs, milk, and salt.
Form into loaf in baking pan.
Slice and serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

items.name: Creamy Chicken Alfredo
items.description: Rich, creamy pasta in a small satisfying portion.

items.name: Baked White Fish & Rice
items.description: Light, flaky fish with butter and lemon over white rice.

instructions: Top with butter and lemon juice.
Bake at 375F for 15-20 minutes until flaky.

items.name: Shepherd's Pie Bowl
items.description: Ground turkey topped with creamy mashed potatoes.

instructions: Place turkey in bowl, mix with gravy.

categories.name: Mexican Comforts
categories.description: Soft, cheesy, satisfying - Mexican flavors made gentle.

items.name: Soft Chicken Enchiladas
items.description: Baked tender and cheesy. A Larry favorite.

instructions: Fill tortillas with chicken and cheese.
Roll and place seam-down in baking dish.
Cover with enchilada sauce and more cheese.
Bake at 350F for 20 minutes until bubbly.

items.name: Cheese Enchilada Bake
items.description: Soft, cheesy, and perfectly satisfying.

instructions: Roll and place in baking dish.
Cover with sauce and more cheese.

items.name: Chicken Quesadilla (Soft)
items.description: Melted, not crispy. Easy to eat.

instructions: Place chicken and cheese on one tortilla.
Cook on medium-low until cheese melts (don't crisp).
Cut into wedges, serve with sour cream.

items.name: Mexican Chicken Rice Bowl
items.description: Rice, chicken, sauce, cheese - simple and satisfying.

items.name: Enchilada Casserole Scoop
items.description: All the enchilada flavors, spoonable comfort.

instructions: Layer torn tortillas, chicken, sauce, and cheese in baking dish.

items.name: Turkey Taco Rice Bowl
items.description: Mild taco flavors over rice. No shell needed.

instructions: Add taco seasoning and a little water, simmer.
Top with cheese and sour cream.

items.name: Mexican Mashed Potato Bowl
items.description: Creamy potatoes with taco turkey and all the toppings.

items.name: Cheesy Chicken Taquitos (Soft)
items.description: Rolled tortillas baked just until warm, not crispy.

instructions: Place filling on edge of each tortilla, roll tight.

categories.name: Air Fryer Favorites
categories.description: All the crispy comfort, none of the deep-fry fat. Air frying cuts fat by up to 80%.

items.name: Air Fryer BBQ Wings
items.description: Tender wings glazed in sweet BBQ. Larry's fried-food fix.

instructions: Pat wings dry, season with paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Spray air fryer basket with cooking spray.
Air fry at 380F for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.
Toss with BBQ sauce in last 3 minutes.
Serve tender (not crunchy) with extra sauce for dipping.

items.name: Air Fryer Butter Garlic Wings
items.description: All the wing flavor without the heat. Buttery, garlicky, and safe.

instructions: Season wings with salt and garlic powder.
Spray air fryer basket, arrange wings.
Air fry at 380F for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway.
Toss in melted butter and extra garlic powder.

items.name: Air Fryer Pork Chops
items.description: Juicy, tender chops with a smoky seasoning. Quick and easy.

instructions: Mix paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt.
Rub seasoning on both sides of pork chops.
Spray air fryer basket, place chops in single layer.
Air fry at 375F for 10-12 minutes, flipping halfway.
Let rest 3 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes and gravy.

items.name: Air Fryer Chicken Tenders
items.description: Crispy outside, tender inside. Dip in BBQ, gravy, or honey.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into strips
instructions: Mix breadcrumbs with paprika, garlic powder, and salt.
Dip chicken strips in egg, then coat in breadcrumb mixture.
Spray air fryer basket, arrange tenders in single layer.
Air fry at 375F for 10-12 minutes, flipping halfway.
Serve with BBQ sauce or gravy for dipping.

items.name: Air Fryer French Fries
items.description: Golden fries with almost no oil. A safe indulgence.

instructions: Peel potatoes and cut into thin sticks.
Soak in cold water 30 minutes, then pat completely dry.
Spray lightly with cooking spray, season with salt.
Air fry at 380F for 15-20 minutes, shaking basket halfway.

items.name: Air Fryer Teriyaki Chicken
items.description: Sweet and savory glazed chicken. Chinese buffet flavor at home.

instructions: Toss chicken cubes with half the teriyaki sauce, garlic powder, and ginger.
Spray air fryer basket, add chicken in single layer.
Air fry at 375F for 12-15 minutes, shaking halfway.

items.name: Air Fryer Sweet & Sour Chicken
items.description: Crispy chicken bites in tangy sweet sauce. Buffet classic, made safe.

instructions: Toss chicken cubes in egg, then coat in cornstarch.
Spray air fryer basket, arrange chicken.
Air fry at 375F for 12 minutes, shaking halfway.
Toss cooked chicken with sweet and sour sauce.

categories.name: Open-Face Sandwiches
categories.description: Smothered, melted, and fork-friendly. All the sandwich flavor, none of the struggle.

items.name: Hot Turkey & Gravy
items.description: Classic diner open-face. Turkey piled high, smothered in gravy.

instructions: Pour gravy generously over turkey and bread.

items.name: BBQ Pork Melt
items.description: Shredded BBQ pork with melted cheese on soft white bread.

instructions: Mix shredded pork with BBQ sauce, warm through.
Pile BBQ pork on each slice.
Broil until cheese melts. Serve open-face.

items.name: Larry's Reuben
items.description: Reuben-inspired with tender turkey and Swiss. All the flavor, safe for Larry.

instructions: Lay bread slices on baking sheet.
Pile shredded turkey on each slice.
Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly.

items.name: Hot Beef & Gravy
items.description: Tender ground beef smothered in brown gravy over soft bread.

instructions: Brown ground beef, drain fat well.

items.name: Chicken Parmesan Melt
items.description: Tender chicken, marinara, and melted mozzarella. Italian comfort.

instructions: Broil until cheese melts. Serve open-face.

categories.name: Pizza Night
categories.description: Soft crust, melty cheese, endless toppings. Pizza made Larry-safe.

items.name: Classic Cheese Pizza Toast
items.description: Simple, melty, and satisfying. White bread makes the perfect soft crust.

instructions: Spread marinara sauce on each bread slice.
Bake at 375F for 8-10 minutes until cheese is bubbly.

items.name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
items.description: BBQ sauce base with chicken and cheese on a soft tortilla.

instructions: Spread BBQ sauce as the base.
Top with shredded chicken and cheese.
Bake at 375F for 8-10 minutes until cheese melts.

items.name: Butter Garlic Chicken Pizza
items.description: Rich butter garlic base, tender chicken, melty cheese. No red sauce needed.

instructions: Mix melted butter with garlic powder.
Bake at 375F for 8-10 minutes. Slice and serve.

items.name: Enchilada Pizza
items.description: Mexican meets Italian. Enchilada sauce, chicken, cheese, sour cream.

instructions: Spread enchilada sauce as the base.
Drizzle with sour cream after baking.

items.name: Cheeseburger Pizza Toast
items.description: All the cheeseburger flavors on a soft bread crust.

instructions: Top with ground beef and cheese.
Bake at 375F for 8-10 minutes until cheese melts.
Add a small drizzle of mustard if desired.

categories.name: Chinese Takeout (Homemade)
categories.description: All the buffet favorites, made at home with low sodium. Restaurant Chinese is way too salty.

items.name: Chicken Lo Mein
items.description: Soft noodles, tender chicken, savory sauce. Better than takeout.

instructions: Cook noodles until very soft, drain.
In a pan, warm chicken with broth.
Add soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic powder, and ginger.
Toss in noodles and stir to coat.
Serve warm. Add extra broth if desired for easier digestion.

items.name: Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowl
items.description: Sweet teriyaki glaze over tender chicken and fluffy rice.

instructions: Warm chicken with teriyaki sauce in a pan.
Add soft carrots on the side.

items.name: Chicken Fried Rice
items.description: Day-old rice, scrambled egg, tender chicken. Homemade and low sodium.

ingredients: 2 cups cooked white rice (day-old is best)
instructions: Scramble eggs in a pan, set aside and chop small.
Spray pan with cooking spray, add rice over medium heat.
Add chicken, eggs, and soft peas.
Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, toss to combine.

items.name: Sesame Chicken
items.description: Crispy air fried chicken in a sweet sesame glaze. Better than the buffet.

instructions: Toss chicken cubes in egg, then coat in cornstarch.
Air fry at 375F for 12 minutes, shaking halfway.
Mix soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil in a small pan, warm through.
Toss cooked chicken in sesame glaze.

items.name: Garlic Beef & Rice Bowl
items.description: Savory ground beef with garlic and soy over rice. Simple Chinese comfort.

instructions: Brown ground beef, drain fat well.
Add garlic powder, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
Stir to combine and warm through.
Serve over white rice with soft carrots.

items.name: Teriyaki Pork Noodle Bowl
items.description: Shredded pork in teriyaki over soft noodles. Comfort in a bowl.

instructions: Cook noodles until very soft, drain.
Warm shredded pork with teriyaki sauce, ginger, garlic, and broth.
Toss noodles with pork and sauce.

categories.name: Snacks & Mini-Meals
categories.description: Easy calories between meals. These keep Larry fueled all day.

items.name: Yogurt with Honey
items.description: Quick protein and easy calories.

items.name: PB & Honey Toast
items.description: Quick calories and protein. Simple comfort.

instructions: Toast bread until just lightly golden.
Spread peanut butter on each slice.

items.name: Warm Applesauce & Cinnamon
items.description: Gentle, sweet, and soothing.

items.name: Protein Pudding Cup
items.description: Creamy, satisfying, protein-packed.

items.name: Cottage Cheese & Pears
items.description: Protein-rich and naturally sweet.

items.name: Vanilla Protein Milkshake
items.description: Liquid calories when solid food is tough. Stomach handles liquids better.

items.name: Mini Pizza Toast
items.description: Quick cheesy snack. One slice, big flavor.

instructions: Bake at 375F for 5-7 minutes until bubbly.

categories.name: Sweet Treats
categories.description: These aren't cheats - they're medically ideal. Soft, easy calories that the stomach handles well.

items.name: Banana Pudding
items.description: Cool, creamy, and perfect for evenings.

instructions: Layer pudding, bananas, and wafers in dish.

items.name: Rice Pudding
items.description: Warm cinnamon comfort. An ideal food.

instructions: Combine rice, milk, and sugar in saucepan.
Simmer on low 20 minutes, stirring often.
Serve warm with cinnamon on top.

items.name: Bread Pudding
items.description: Soft, custardy, and deeply comforting.

instructions: Place bread cubes in buttered baking dish.
Whisk milk, eggs, sugar, and vanilla.
Pour over bread, let soak 15 minutes.

items.name: Peach Cobbler
items.description: Sweet canned peaches with soft topping.

instructions: Pour melted butter in baking dish.
Mix flour, sugar, and milk into batter.

items.name: Ice Cream
items.description: Simple, smooth, and always welcome.

items.name: Vanilla Custard
items.description: Silky smooth and easy to digest.

instructions: Slowly add hot milk to egg mixture, whisking.
Return to pan, cook until thick.

items.name: Peanut Butter Swirl Ice Cream
items.description: Extra calories and protein in every bite.

coreIngredients.description: All recipes should be built from these safe, approved ingredients. Low sodium versions required.

weekly: Cook and shred 6 chicken breasts (use for everything: lo mein, pizza, sandwiches, bowls)
Slow cook and shred a pork loin with balsamic OR butter garlic
Make a large pot of mashed potatoes
Cook a big batch of white rice (save some day-old for fried rice)
Brown and season ground turkey for the week
Make a big pot of chicken broth or egg drop soup
Mix up teriyaki and BBQ sauces in squeeze bottles for quick meals
Air fry a batch of chicken tenders for quick snacks
alwaysStock: Canned soups (cream of mushroom, chicken, tomato)
Low-sodium soy sauce and teriyaki sauce
freezerFriendly: Portioned soups (especially egg drop and chicken noodle)
Air fryer chicken tenders (reheat in air fryer)

categories.name: Raw Vegetables
categories.reason: Fiber sits in stomach for hours

categories.name: Whole Grains
categories.reason: High fiber is worst for gastroparesis

categories.name: Cured & Processed Meats
categories.reason: Extremely high sodium - dangerous for portal hypertension

categories.name: Deep-Fried Foods
categories.reason: Fat plus reflux risk (air fryer is OK)

categories.name: Spicy Foods
categories.reason: Triggers acid reflux which can cause varices to bleed, can trigger vomiting

categories.name: Nuts & Seeds
categories.reason: Don't digest well, sit in stomach

categories.name: Carbonation & Alcohol
categories.reason: Expands stomach, portal pressure, variceal risk

categories.name: Large Meals
categories.reason: Stomach can't empty - 90% retention at 4 hours

dailySchedule.description: Eat every 2-3 hours. Stop before feeling full. Liquids are your friend.

meals.examples: Egg drop soup, chicken noodle, lo mein soup
Air fryer, pizza night, Chinese, sandwich
